urls.title: Horror at destruction of nationally important UK river | The Wildlife Trusts
urls.description: Major damage to River Lugg in Herefordshire will be test case for Government commitment to strengthen wildlife protection.

tweets.text:
A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

Guardian: @EnvAgency slashes number of water pollution incident visits amid rising fears water industry is now polluting UK rivers with impunity putting the health of river users and unique ecosystems at risk https://t.co/FbjqetyRzY via @Feargal_Sharkey @bilgribs

urls.title: Programme & Registration | Flood & Coast
urls.description: Telford International Centre, UK The 2021 Flood and Coast conference and expo will take place on Hopin, a virtual event platform designed to feel like an in-person event. Each day will be fully packed with interactive sessions, live exhibition booths and networking opportunities,‚ÄØwith‚ÄØthe audience‚ÄØaddressing some of the most important issues in FCERM. Delegates will interact with speakers through the live Q & A sessions, meet with exhibitors in our live expo hall, and connect with new people through

tweets.text: Join me next week as I host the next #FloodandCoast digital session on 9 Dec discussing the #ClimateEmergency and featuring speakers @CvNieuwenhuizen, @SaleemulHuq, @DeniseBower1310 and @annietrev. Book tickets here: https://t.co/diXMjPkfo5. @EnvAgency https://t.co/mmB6dDXCmf

tweets.text:
@RachSalv @CraigBennett3 @HelenStace_HWT @WildlifeTrusts @HerefordshireWT Useless Environment Agency and/or Natural England enforcement will probably do nothing about it. 

Put a twig in the wrong place as part of a permitted habitat project or stewardship scheme though... They'll come down on you like a ton of bricks!

@RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency Beyond prosecution, there really needs to be some sort of restorative justice process. Fines may deter (if prosecution is successful), but this damage needs repairing and the environment repaired and encouraged to return - although that will take years.

@TheMontyDon Appalling especially as the River Lugg is such an important historical and archaeological artefact for #Herefordshire -  hope @HfdsCouncil @EnvAgencyMids @DaveThroupEA and @Jesse_Norman @BillWigginMP can ensure something is done

tweets.text: Incomprehensible this amount of work proceeded without the intervention of @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency To not deal with this robustly will be a mockery to the determined efforts by @WildlifeTrusts @theriverstrust @WildTroutTrust @SalmonTroutCons & others to protect our rivers https://t.co/S5bYnqGTJi

@DJ_Renney @inthesticks @Feargal_Sharkey @MilesKing10 @GeorgeMonbiot Need to be careful not to prejudice any prosecutions by naming anyone prematurely. The statutory agencies are on the case - I hope. @NaturalEngland have issued a stop order. Not sure yet what @ForestryComm @EnvAgency or @HfdsCouncil have done. @HerefordshireWT are pressuring hard
